fs.fibu2.view.render
Interface JournalModule

All Known Implementing Classes:
BilancialModule, ChartModule, ExportModule, FilterModule, OverviewModule
public interface JournalModule

A journal module is a generic component for editing / displaying an fsfibu2 journal. A journal module might be for example a tabbed pane for filter views of a journal or just a panel with several diagrams. When fsfibu2 is started, for each module registered with the JournalModuleLoader or corresponding class file in the modules/ folder, one tab is added to the main tabbed view. Each class implementing this interface should have a nullary constructor.

Author:
Simon Hampe

The string to display as name of the tab. Can be null.

getComponent

javax.swing.JPanel getComponent(java.util.prefs.Preferences node,
                                Journal j)
Parameters:
node - The Preferences node in which the configuration of this module is placed. If the configuration is not a valid configuration, this method should nevertheless return normally, possibly with a component initialized to standard values. The preference node might in particular be null.
j - The journal on which this component should work.
Returns:
The actual visual component of the module which is displayed in the tab. It should be the same component for all calls of this method with the same journal

getID

java.lang.String getID()
Returns:
The (unique) ID of this module. The convention is 'ff2module_(descriptivestring)'
